sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for the indicative prefix (e.g. b- , k- ).

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found
updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

wib:featureValueObservation.note: The b- indicative is used to express habitual actions and future; the indicativve without b- prefix is used as imperative and in subordinative clauses

B- indicative is used with habitual actions, to indicate progressive aspect and future. The indicative is mostly used without b- prefix when it is dependent from another predicate (Herin 2010: 249-250)

cit.quote: Does he understand what we say?

wib:featureValueObservation.note: "Indivative with b- prefix was introduced in the last 20/30 years. B- indicative occurs in the following contexts, arranged in terms of increasing frequency: after coordinate u dependent on verb wudd/widd, subordinate cl. n- we, t- maa (neg.) first sing, third person. (Some of the contexts are not mutually exclusive, e.g., n- we occurs in subordinate clauses, after u and, etc., though we did not check the combined effect of these variable factors on the distribution of b-.) What this says is that b- is least likely to occur after u "and" and in a position dependent on a verb or on wudd "want"; it is a little more common (though not much) in subordinate clauses (adverbial and conditionals constitute the largest sets of tokens here) and before the person prefix n- we; it occurs occasionally, though still in less than 60 percent of the tokens, after negative maa and with first person subjects and the subject markers t- (second person, third feminine, cf.2.1). By far its most extensive occurrence is with a third person subject in main, non-negative clause." (Owens 1984:214)
Deduced from examples
Does not seem to be systematic, deduced from examples
Rarely the b-prefix is used.
Rarely the b-prefix is used.
Deduced from example
There is no mention of the indicative prefix by the author

cit.quote: il-mara taḥsel l-art u t-tifla taʔra
The woman washes the floor and the girl reads

wib:featureValueObservation.note: The prefix b- is only attached with the 3.p.sg and pl. forms

cit.quote: I take a lesson in Arabic every day
Urfa kull-u b-ᵊrmaḏ̣ān yišrab mayyt as-sūs.
The whole of Urfa drinks liquorice syrup in Ramadan.
